result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald E Engel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 6 days sentence credit if revoked. Court grants Huber.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on 11/2/2016.

miscConds.notes: $500.00 cash bond applied. Balance will be returned to whomever posted it. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must have no contact with H.J.B. 
Must have no contact with any juvenile females unless in the presence of a parent or guardian.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must complete psycho-sexual evaluation and follow through with any recommendations. Sex offender registration is held open.   Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on 11/3/16 between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.
